intro: Burmeistera villosa, commonly known as the woolly burmeistera, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its foliage is often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, fuzzy appearance. Burmeistera villosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in partial shade.
